page.title: 01COUNTRYSIDE SOUTH OF DALSTON
page.content: Our area ranges from Bridge End, Dalston, in the north to Rose Castle in the south, and from Raughton in the east to Hawkesdale in the west. It is mainly country land with a few hamlets dotted around. These hamlets include Hawksdale, Unthank, Raughton and Gaitsgill (or Gatesgill). The land is rolling and mainly used for pasture. There are many woods and the River Roe joins the River Caldew half a mile west of Raughton. There are small, narrow roads which join up each hamlet. There is one "B" road, the B5299. There is little industry in the area but at Bridge End, Dalston, there is a fairly large cotton wool factory. In the centre of our area, there is Lime House School. South-west of that is Rose Castle, where the Bishop of Carlisle lives.
